subject: Politics
title: Tyranny of the Majority
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Tyranny of the Majority.

hook.text: If 51% vote to strip rights from the other 49%, is that democracy or oppression? Majority rule has a dark side.

buildup.text: Tocqueville and Mill warned that majority rule can crush minorities. Democracy needs limits to protect the vulnerable.

discovery.text: Constitutional rights, judicial review, and bills of rights exist to prevent majorities from trampling minorities.

twist.text: Populist leaders claim to speak for 'the people' and attack courts and constitutions as obstacles to majority will.

climax.text: Healthy democracy requires both majority rule and minority rights. Remove either and the system breaks.

punchline.text: Democracy isn't just majority rule. It's majority rule with limits.

quiz.question: What protects minorities from tyranny of the majority?
options: Constitutional rights, judicial review, and bills of rights
Giving the majority unlimited power to make all decisions
